author: jeffyang1
title: Functional cardano hardware
description:
Como podemos conseguir mais hardware para ser projetado para a comunidade Cardano?
Que tipo de hardware podemos produzir que todos vão querer comprar?

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

This challenge aims to incentivize hardware makers to build new hardware for Cardano. This can support one of the strategic objectives for Fund8 - growing the contributors to Cardano ecosystem.

At the same time, this proposal would be stronger if it provided a discussion why focusing on subset of use cases (hardware) could provide a higher ROI  to the community. Especially because the hardware is considered as harder to do well than software.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for addressing only one out of three strategic objectives of Fund 8.
- 1 point for not providing an explanation how focusing on this niche could lead to higher ROI than broader challenges.
- 1 point for the lack of example success stories, helping to judge the impact of individual initiatives.
My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q1:
The cardano community can definitely provide funding and support development of software components. However, hardware is completely new area, what could be a risk.

In addition, the proposal would be stronger if it:
1) provided some analysis of specific use cases where hardware could unlock cardano adoption, helping to judge about the necesary skills and resources.
2) provided examples of successful projects, helping to understand the sufficiency of the budget to achieve a noticeable impact.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point because hardware is not the primary expertise of the community.
- 1 point for the lack of specific use cases.
- 1 point for the lack of the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
Ma rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal suggests some metrics that can help track its progress (the number of parts, the number of new users, etc).

Having said that those metrics provide only a partial view on the impact. To make the proposal stronger, I'd suggest considering the following metrics:
1) % of Cardano users using the developed hardware.
2) % of Cardano transaction volume facilitated with the developed hardware.
3) user satisfaction - shipping units is not the same as making the users happy.
4) competitiveness - how do ($ price, user satisfaction, etc.) of the developed hardware looks into comparison to alternatives.

I made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluting the impact on Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluting user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: Bringing hardware makers into the Cardano ecosystem does align with the Cardano mission at least on a theoretical level. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: Integrating hardware design and manufacturing into the Cardano ecosystem is a unique idea. The Cardano branding of knives is not a good example however there might be a case for something like a networked 3D-printer that allowed users to remotely print objects for an Ada fee. There is potential with the challenge however the challenge needs more fine tuning, specifically hardware projects should make use of Ada or otherwise integrate with the Cardano ecosystem so that projects are relevant to the community which is a prerequisite to having the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are generally fine however the "open source market place" referenced seems to be a specific solution proposal unless there is an open source hardware market place for the Cardano community that I am unaware of. If there is no such market place then I recommend submitting a proposal for making one for makers and open source hardware designers since that is an excellent idea.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge proposal does not really have a lot to do with Cardanos mission, or the relation is not explained. What benefit this challenge has to the general society remains unexplained.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge does not really define what kind of hardware is supposed to be produced and how it should be related to Cardano. If it would specify to provide blockchain specific equipment, that would maybe make more sense, however it is difficult to provide a feasible solution on such common, undefined terms. The proposer does not indicate whether there's a challenge team or not. I am not sure there will be a variety of solutions available in proposals in this challenge, as the composition of the Catalyst community mostly consists of people from other areas than manufacturers.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are measuring outcomes, however they are not that well-defined, because as mentioned above, what actually is going to be achieved is not explained very well.

importance: A maioria das pessoas ainda não entende o mundo digital. Ter um incrível hardware funcional construído pela Cardano vai acelerar as adoções.
success: Hardware que é construído pela comunidade Cardano na casa de todos, que é usado diariamente.
